author: chfast
content: The test `tests/prague/eip7002_el_triggerable_withdrawals/test_modified_withdrawal_contract.py::test_extra_withdrawals[fork_Prague-blockchain_test-15_withdrawal_requests]` in EEST v4.2.0 looks like completely broken. The bytecode for 7002 starts with "333337..." what is `CALLER CALLER CODEDATACOPY` what causes EVM stack underflow.

author: felix314159_
content: hi we made changes to this in our new release, please use eest 4.3.0

author: chfast
content: Shouldn't you put this in the changelog?

author: danceratopz
content: The changes to 7002 and 7251 are listed in breaking changes? The PR is: https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/pull/1394

author: chfast
content: This doesn't explain it fully, but nvm

author: chfast
content: The recent changes to requests system contracts made EEST v4.3.0 incompatible with ethereum/tests. ethereum/tests had not been updated. Nobody runs it anymore? <@393119312350543872> <@892053833121923094>

author: marioevz
content:
We've heard complains definitely, it just takes a bit more time to propagate the updates back to ethereum/tests since it's separate tooling that needs to be updated and <@393119312350543872> is the only person that can do this atm.
We already have support in EEST to fill the yml/json fillers, but it's going to take a couple more weeks for us to bring this fillers to eest and basically deprecate ethereum/tests.

content: I think we can simply push to merge the two PRs in eest to fill these tests, and make a new eest release
